greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(n-A035316(n), A285309(n)-n), where A035316 and A285309 give respectively the sums of square and nonsquare divisors of n.
comment: Below 2^27 there are following numbers k such that a(k) is equal to A326059(k), and quotient A326058(k)/A326059(k) is odd: 6, 28, 496, 1625, 2057, 8128, 33550336, 107452235. The odd terms are factored as: 1625 = 5^3 * 13, 2057 = 11^2 * 17, 107452235 = 5 * 11^2 * 97 * 1831.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 06 2019
